intro: Lepigonum purpureum, commonly known as purple wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, purple flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
